subject: Programming
title: The Open-Closed Principle
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Open-Closed Principle.

hook.text: Adding a new payment method shouldn't require rewriting the entire checkout system.

buildup.text: The Open-Closed Principle says code should be open for extension but closed for modification.

discovery.text: Well-designed systems let you add new behavior by adding new code, not changing existing code.

twist.text: Achieving this requires forethought ‚Äî interfaces, abstractions, and plugin architectures.

climax.text: The payoff is stability. Existing features don't break when new ones are added.

punchline.text: Add new behavior without touching old code.

quiz.question: What does 'open for extension, closed for modification' mean?
options: Add features by adding code, not changing existing code
